intro: Otospermum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth otospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, dry fruits called achene. Otospermum glabrum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
